(ooc: my son is better now, so I'll be posting more often. Thank you all for 
being patient with me :)

Mantle watched most of his missiles fail to hit and sighed. These bots were 
more than the normal attackers that he was used to fighting, but challenge 
was always good.

"Whoa!" he exclaimed when a shadow passed over him from a gestalt forming, 
then another shadow from another gestalt. This was getting very interesting! 
He saw Prowl transform into a big monster, and then decided to bring out the 
big guns. "Eletors, unite!" he yeled the order and looked down to see the 
Eletors reacting to the call. Aqua and Rubble transformed into legs, Cinder 
and Mist into arms, and Mantle, last but not least, into the torso and head 
of Element. The huge robot stretched to his full height, taller than any of 
the others by two or three feet. The confident personality of the five 
combined minds took control.

"You'd better run now and save your life, Decepticon," said Element while 
approaching Abominus, the gestalt that was closest to him. A plate on each 
shoulder slid aside and a missile launcher emerged to cover the space where 
the plates were. The two launchers locked onto Abominus and fired two 
missiles each, mentally guided by Element to hit their target.


Cyndro saw that his weapon fire was getting close to hitting the Maximals, 
and eased off of the enemies that were close to friends. Instead, he 
concentrated on the gestalts, using the missile launchers of the Element as 
his main weapon. Two missile launchers locked onto each enemy gestalt, each 
one firing two missiles. The missiles that were fired were radio-guided by 
Cyndro to hit their targets. His other weapons focused on the lone bots that 
wern't close to Maximals. He sent three EMP blasts along with several laser 
shots at Divebomb, and the same barrauge of weaponfire at Rampage. His 
jammers were still blocking any transmissions by anyone but the Maximals and 
the bots that were assisting them, so the attackers wouldn't be able to send 
for reinforcements or communicate with each other.
